meanings.definition: To emerge or cause to emerge from sleep
meanings.sent1: I wake up early every morning to start my day.
meanings.sent2: She wakes up with a smile on her face every day.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock tried to wake me up, but I hit snooze.
meanings.sent4: The chirping birds outside my window wake me up gently.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee is a great way to wake up.

meanings.definition: The track left by a moving ship
meanings.sent1: The wake behind the boat stretched out far into the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The captain watched the wake disappear into the horizon.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls followed the ship's wake looking for food.
meanings.sent4: The wake of the ship shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The wake created beautiful patterns on the water.

meanings.definition: A vigil held over a deceased person before burial
meanings.sent1: The family gathered for the wake to honor their loved one.
meanings.sent2: During the wake, stories of the deceased were shared.
meanings.sent3: The wake was a time for reflection and remembrance.
meanings.sent4: The wake provided closure and comfort to the family.
meanings.sent5: The wake was a solemn but meaningful event.
